title: Decent app but a pain!
text: Why do I have to keep signing in? I should sign in once and that's it! Enable touch login or something. Quit making me type in my password. The improvements made in the last update make using the device much easier and the UI is nice. Let's get the functionality in check :)

title: The best camera on the market
text: The cameras have been great! I own 3 - both NV and not.  The peace of mind they provide is priceless. The cost was in line with others HOWEVER there is no monthly fee YET if needed you can call their support. I did call once as I had a question during setup and they were very responsive and friendly.  The picture quality is great, the alarm is extremely loud. The video records just before the event triggered the recording so you can view just before. My only wish - that the Piper would come out with an outdoor version. Great product. I recommended to my son-in-law for his business and shortly thereafter they had a fire in the building while they were out of town. The Piper alerted him and he was able to watch the fire dept arrive and put it out.

title: Good App and good unit
text:
This Piper has worked very well. I have the Piper NV. Been a little frustrated lately with this app as it doesn't always retain my password and I have to keep signing in again and again. 

The Piper for us has been excellent. We have had almost no issues and it gets the push messages to us very quickly - usually within about 10 seconds of an event. 

The only major issue we had was when we changed our internet provider and had to reactivate it on the new network. The steps are rather daunting. After multiple failed attempts, we ended up calling support and even he had issues. Holding this button and waiting for that color is not user friendly and support missed a step twice and we had to keep redoing it - took over 40 minutes on the phone.

title: Used to be useful
text: I’ve had the piper for a few years now and for the most part I’ve found it to be dependable. My biggest disappointment has come of recent with the discontinuation of IFTTT support. I’m sure it has to do with money, it’s always about money... but IFTTT really covered the spaces where pipers app lacked. One simple feature is just having a simple on/off time, geofencing is nice when it works... and come on guys, Life360 integration has been in beta for more than 3 years! Honestly the updates are bug fixes and that’s it, no advances in the usefulness of the app. The Home Vitals is a good feature, but it’s really just statistics, you can’t do anything with it, and it only keeps 48 hours at a time on record. There are a lot more features this app could provide, but it really just feels like the company has stopped caring and given up.

title: Have used for 2 yrs
text: I did a lot of research a few years ago for a simple home security system. Piper is exactly what I was looking for and it has worked well for us when gone for extended periods. I can set it to record a video clip and turn on a light and text me when there’s movement in the house and I’m not there. That’s all I need. When we’re on vacation I would then call my local home police department to come and investigate. I’ll have a video clip to share with police. I can also use the app to simply turn the camera on and see what the camera sees at any given time. I know what the temperature is in my house and I can see that all is well.

title: Too slow
text:
Useful alarm function unless someone simply unplugs it. Also...if you set the alarm off yourself, the app will NEVER connect in time to turn it off before it starts blaring. I wrote this review while waiting for it to connect...it is still giving me the spinning wheel of death and so now I have to reset the whole system once I plug it in again.
Update: had someone else in the house who unplugged the piper due to the alarm. Was off for 3 days. Now having to hard reboot each device as well as re-add every accessory. Had to reboot the. Main piper twice. Each time taking 10+ minutes, which is a new bonus. Not a good use of time. Not the best camera on the market. Doesn’t play with its own, let alone other systems well. Will not purchase again.

title: Multi Piper cams
text:
Ice have had 4 Piper cameras, several Zwave lights, several motion detectors. When power goes out and comes back, sometimes Piper recovers well. Lately I’m not sure what is going on.
On October 20th something changed and the app says Piper is offline, usually I do a power off, wait, wait and then power on and it comes back.
I have spent allllll day doing resets, factory resets, setups and nothing is finishing. I had messages that passwords, that have been in use are not valid. So far I can’t recover my Piper system. 
I’m not even sure Piper support is out there anymore. I’ve tried calling the support number and it always rings busy. 
Not very happy with my system anymore. Lots of investment in Piper supported lights, motion detectors, and it’s all crap now

title: Long time user, great experience
text: I have greatly enjoyed and appreciated my Piper. I look several years later and still nothing comes close. I can see my door openings and closings on video, motion recordings, temperature, movement graphs, and more - no extra fee and recordings are held. I have not had connection issues, although I have to re- add devices, mainly after big power outages. I’m sad the big guys have made them disappear when it is the best home device out there.

title: Home and business
text: I’ve got two setups for home and business.  They work GREAT.  The cameras are superb.  The only reason I only gave 4 stars is for the occasional connection drops where they lose connectivity and don’t reconnect automatically.  Although this occurs rarely, when it does it’s a pain in the tush to re-connect.  I would love for them to come out with exterior units as well!  Having one at my door would be wonderful!

title: New update make wireless accessories fail
text: Now the on and off wireless accessories do not work in new updates anymore. When I remove them from the app and try to add the wireless accessories back, it does not work at all. Like usually when you add the wireless accessories, it should has a pop up said you can click your wireless accessories to pair. But now, they don’t have this pop up and directly said no signal from your wireless accessories. I’m happy to see continue improvement on the app. But please keep the basic functionality work first. Home security should be serious!!!

title: Product no longer sold by Piper. Connectivity issues are bad.
text:
Connectivity issues are bad. Worst is when connection is lost, alarm goes off, but there is NO way to turn it off using app. To prevent ear damage, we hide them under a pillow in a drawer in the closet until the battery goes dead.   Now one Piper is impossible to connect, goes into endless connecting loop. Support says thus is a new bug in the app.

Product is no longer sold by Piper. Piper support says they will continue to support, but endless support with no revenue seems unlikely. More likely company will go out of business.

title: Connectivity issues

This app gets worse with every update. Connectivity issues, live stream not working right. How you guys actually fix the app instead of messing around?

title: Stealing passwords/data from clipboard!
text:
Opening the Piper app shows an iOS 14 notification “Piper pasted from xxxxx” (whatever app you last copied something from). This is a well known vulnerability which Apple refuses to address, and iControl Networks doesn’t care to update over the last 2 years. The company that bought them out doesn’t even sell product anymore, just collecting our passwords and other data via this sneaky app.

Oh and we lost IFTTT implementation when the company sold out too. Terrible.

title: Great features, only if they work
text:
The video consistently hangs. The video doesn't load or when it does, keeps hanging, so I am forced to restart. I have to do this multiple times to get it to work. The images, sound and motion are not aligned most of the time, making it extremely frustrating and nearly impossible to monitor for a few minutes straight versus just getting some snapshots. This is not my internet issue as I use many streaming services without an issue. 

Very disappointed with the app.

title: Yeah!!!!!!
text: Thank you, thank you. We can now set a morning and evening on/off schedules for connected accessories. I've really lived my Piper for about two years but have been asking and waiting for this one feature. Thank you for this update. Now it's about the perfect home system!

title: Works great!
text: The app works great! Especially appreciate the new update - like being able to read the thermostat from the home page. Whatever problems the app used to have, they are gone now - the app is very reliable.

title: Solid Improvements

title: Easy!
text: For those of you who dont want to wire up your whole house or get some complicated expensive system this is for you. Im no millionaire so I dont need all that crap. This is simple to use and keeps an eye on my stuff without costing me an arm and a leg!!!

title: Great product but there are flaws
text:
I have owned a Piper Night Vision for almost a year and use it on a daily basis in my small apartment. It works pretty well as far as sensors, unit operation, and quality goes. But my biggest complaint is once the device is triggered it records about a 30second video and then stops recording and you either manually re-arm the device thru the phone app or have it auto re-arm every 5 minutes. So if I can't use my phone when the Piper is triggered, when I'm driving for example, this gives me only 30seconds of recorded security footage every 5 minutes maximum. A lot can happen in 5 minutes where I won't have any video recording! I would like to see longer videos recorded once a device is triggered and an option for instant re-arm after a video is recorded. If server size is an issue then you can limit for how long or how much data can be stored before it's removed.
Also, I would like to have the option to record a video while I'm in the live feed screen, so if unauthorized activity is occurring while I'm in the live feed, I can make a recording. 

I know multiple people who have looked for such a device as this and I would definitely recommend it more if I see the issues above addressed. Keep up the hard work, I think this device still has more potential.

title: Worked at first...
text:
The app worked at first, but now is very limited. I cannot connect to the Piper over the cellular network, only wifi. Even when speeds over cellular are actually faster than wifi. I've checked all my settings, and contacted Piper, who basically advised me to "turn it off and turn it back on again" and then asked a bunch of questions I'd already provided answers for. My wife's phone connects just fine, running the same OS but a different carrier. If I can't get it fixed, this app (and the camera itself) are relatively useless to me.

UPDATE: Piper has fixed the problem. It works well now, so I'm adding a star for that. However, having to jump through a bunch of support hoops for what, as it turns out, was a known issue was annoying. Having to find out, after opening a support case, that the problem was solved by reading about it in someone else's review was also bad. title: Useless without re-arm feature, multi-piper even more useless
text: It has great potential. But if anything triggers it, then you are going to miss all subsequent events until you manually re-arm/re-activate it. Let's say you want to see who came and went to your gate/house/cabin/store/whatever. First noise or movement that sets it off will make you miss all subsequent events until you manually reset it. I've called them before and they said "we are considering this". They are nice people, but this is crazy! Like other reviewers sey they do freeze up regularly (maybe once every week or so). That I can even deal with. And if you have multiple pipers, you do not get addition protection, only the "main" piper triggers/records anything once and then it is done. All the other ones do nothing (except let you do a live view) but they are useless as an actual security feature. Maybe they are just trying to save on disc space for themselves and are too cheap to allow for the extra storage this would require. Then state that upfront and/or give options to purchase the required cloud space/or use our own. There are plenty of other options out on market until they hopefully address this main issue. So far it's been over a year and they have not addressed it.

title: Piper keeps you 'piped-in' to your surroundings
text: Piper is a DIY alternative to the traditional security systems out there. Great system for renters, apt/small home dwellers and those with family/kids or pets. I love the two-way audio function because it reminds me of a walkie talkie - be careful doing this to house sitters or others who don't know about your Piper because you may end up scaring someone! :) The sensors are a nice addition in order to keep an eye on your windows and doors but the camera can be used solo. It's also easy to use the app and you can set rules for notifications you want to receive. The Home Vitals tab is also very neat and allows you to gauge the motion/sound/humidity levels, etc. in your house. As for recommendations, I'd like to be able to view video on my computer and record video whenever I choose - not just when a security event occurs. I see Piper as the 'little engine that could' and I think this market is just starting to bloom. It's definitely a trendsetting product and I'm glad it's keeping an eye over our house.

title: Not so much, nor so often...
text: I've had our Piper HD for a few weeks now, testing it in various rooms.  I had high hopes for it as a Z-Wave hub for our new home in a few months.  Well, it's great when it works, which is almost never.  I have strong wifi at home, with a range extender too.  It seems to drop the wifi connection after a few minutes of connection, and WILL NOT RECONNECT! As much as I try, pushing the retry link, unplugging, etc.  the wifi is stable, though AT&T is pretty lame, with drop outs frequent, but Piper should reconnect when it's back on, right? It does not.  I can't even find how to change which wifi it is connected to.  That part is not very user friendly. The app is pretty good, just not good at controlling the connection.  Seems easy enough, I can't understand why it's not reconnecting. The app does give you easy access to recorded video.  Trouble is that it is very slow to connect. Also, the fact that we can't see other reviews is bogus. I think Piper is not releasing them because they are so bad. Right Piper People?

title: Love Piper, needs a few features
text:
I have been using Piper for a few days now and would recommend several updates to the App:

1. It would be nice for Piper to use the phones GPS and automatically turn off when I arrive home.

 2. Adding a section under "rules" for selecting a time and/or date range to activate Piper. For instance, I would like Piper to be able to automatically switch from "off" to "away"( or whatever setting you wish) from 11pm until 6am, while I am asleep. 

3. There needs to be a way to deactivate the siren within the app. Create a separate password to deactivate it- but not being able to turn that thing off easily is a huge problem for the user. 

I have also been having issues with Piper not registering movement and recording videos. It seems it waits a certain amount of time before alerting/recording a new video- this is annoying and a potential reason not to buy Piper. You would think spending the money on a device dedicated to this activity would work better than a simple iPhone app- such as Presence (which uses an old phone/iPad/iPhone as the camera and does essentially everything Piper does)

title: I feel compelled to help these guys out
text:
Not all is broken for users out there. I have been using my Piper NV for about a year now. I was initially frustrated with their new app design, which seemed like an unnecessary change, but I find that I'm not using the app a ton now anyway. Check out the IFTTT app for some cool automation, I use a proximity arm / disarm so that I don't have to open the app to do so - works every time. I also made some buttons on IFTTT so that I can turn my Z-wave lights on and off without going into the app.

The most important thing is that they seem to have stabilized live streaming in the back end - whether through LTE or wireless, I haven't had problems in awhile. The app runs stable and does what it needs to do - I just learned about a 4 minute power outage last night thanks to Piper.

My suggestions for the product team: 
- Give users a data cap for storing video / data, and up the silly 1 min. time restriction on videos. That burglary isn't going to only take a minute - and I don't care about any of the other recordings.

- As a user, when live streaming or viewing recordings, I would like to be able to view it from both orientations (landscape), when i flip my phone over 180 degrees. I never hold my phone the other way, and I'm used to other apps and video flipping in my direction.

title: Not a good step...
text:
This version logs me out daily, asking if I'd like to set up Piper now. If I say yes, I have to re-log in. If I say no, the app shuts down and I have to re-log in later. Either way, super inconvenient. 

This app is MUCH slower than the previous 1.x releases and often never connects to Piper at all, making us prisoners in our own home, unable to disarm the system.

The interface is horrible. I miss the simplicity of the large wheel with the easy-to-see icons. The new ones are confusing and tiny. A text option would be nice. A clean app doesn't have to remove all text... Color-coded *labeled* buttons work fine. 

The Z-wave options should not be buried underneath unmarked menus. If I want to turn a lamp on or off, i have to figure out which button to press (since they're not marked in any way) then find my way to the device. What was a simple option in v1.x is now a multi-step difficult process in 2.x.

What used to be a fantastic system with unparalled support and a great app seems to have been clouded by the misconception that clean and simple means less labeling and more cryptography. As the end user, I ask that you revisit the app redesign again, increase the size of the arming options, place an emphasis on connection quality and speed, and make the interface easier to navigate in a true emergency situation. 

Piper has earned our praise time and time again in conversations and recommendations. Please help us restore our functionality and stability.

title: Working flawlessly, would like more features
text: I purchased the piperNV as my first device and after a smooth set up the device worked exactly as promised with no connectivity issues. I was disappointed to find out after I purchased it that it could only act as a Z wave controller, and not connect to my existing Z wave network. However I hope this will change in the future. The other drawback is the lack of ability to have web based access. I would love to use my existing Z wave network and home automation system to access the cameras, but until they release the ability to, I would need someone much more tech savvy to figure it out (decompile the apk and find how where the app is directed to get access?). Otherwise I liked it so much I picked up two originals (no night vision) on clearance for less than $100 total.

title: Very Intuitive, But Limited
text:
The Piper software is by far the best looking and most intuitive zwave controller app I have used. It's easy to navigate and the data are displayed clearly. Setting up rules for security settings and notifications is very straightforward, and I appreciate all the options including text, email, iOS notification and even phone call.

All that said, the software is a little simplistic in its capabilities; it's only compatible with a very limited range of zwave accessories - at this point just door/window sensors and light switches. No locks, garage door openers, external sensors or other accessories are supported. While these May be supported in the future, one thing this software will ever be is a full controller for zwave systems. At most it will supplement something like a Vera Lite. So keep your expectations in check.

title: Security
text: I bought this after using a Canary for two weeks. The only thing that Canary has over the Piper NV is good-looking graphics, a sleeker device and better video. But if you want a security system and not a home monitoring system that looks cool, go with the Piper. So far, it has been very reliable, and I really appreciate Pet Mode. With Canary, I had to teach it everyday to ignore pets and ghost shadows and small splotches of sunlight, and it still didn't learn. It took me three tries to find a good setting with Piper where it would pick human movement up and not two cats and a dog. Good system. Also, the Piper has a one second delay with video, which is nine seconds better than Canary. I will take better lag than good video any day. Well thought out app and system!

title: Much improved recently
text: I have always been a big fan of the Piper hardware. Unfortunately I had stopped using it due to a couple issues. One, there were frequent connection issues. This seems to mostly be a thing of the past. Two, the lack of any sort of ability to arm and disarm automatically based on time, location, etc. This latest update makes a big leap forward in that regard. I had never heard of Life360, but it seems to work well. The auto-arm feature based on location works great. It is not quite "auto" however. I would prefer an option to remove the requirement to acknowledge the arming and just trust it to arm itself. Also needs the ability to auto disarm upon coming home. Still, a big step towards making Piper as useful as I know it can be.

title: Current App review only
text:
I have been trying to find solutions to the connectivity issue which has gotten progressively worse for us. Neither iPhone will connect via LTE and now via "wifi" either. We're using iPhone 6 and 6s. I have reset the piper and completed an initial set up hoping to resolve the issue to no avail. 
The PiperNV does however still work with IFTTT. I have been able to arm/disarm based upon a schedule. I know that this is not ideal but it allows for some automated protection until this issue is fixed. One thing to be aware of is that IFTTT only allows for arming and disarming formulas in 15 minute increments so you could use it to disarm your piper prior to arriving home outside or your regular schedule but it requires a little bit of planning so that you're sitting outside of your house waiting for the next quarter hour. Alexa works as well. 
Hopefully this will be resolved shortly. Also, Zwave deadbolts please... Yale.

title: Horrible
text: I have had Piper for over a year now and have not experienced any problems up until the Dec. 7th app upgrade. Or should I say downgrade. I cannot access the cameras if I am on the T-mobile network. The only way I can access the cameras is if I am on wifi. I spoke to tech support shortly after the app downgrade and was assured that the "patch" would be completed very soon. Let's see, it is now January 15th. Over one month since I have not been able to use my cameras. It appears the Piper team is not interested in the needs of its customer as they are not concerned with getting this issue fixed any time soon. This is a security system that simply does not work with the app because whatever they did on the December 7th downgrade disabled connectivity on the T-Mobile network. This app has 1.5 stars and I can completely understand why the reviews are so horrible. I will add one star. I wish I could add zero stars. Stay away from Piper and this app. Horrible!!!!

title: Voiceover support for the blind and visually impaired needs to be improved
text: Purchased my new Piper and received it in the mail today. After installing the app, was disappointed to discover that I could set up the device, but cannot actually use it. There are many buttons that need to be labeled and the most important buttons don't show up at all for someone using voice over. This is very disappointing. This device could be very handy for someone who is blind or visually impaired. Unfortunately, even the simplest of functions are not available using apples accessibility. Arming and disarming the system, watching a live camera feed,, accessing the various tabs for rules, notifications and automations are not possible. I am in email contact with the developers and hope they will be interested in making changes so that this product can be used by everyone. For now, I am stuck with a device that I cannot access. Very disappointed.

title: Works well after some hiccups
text:
I have had Piper for about a year. It has been reliable for the past 4 months or so, after several months of intermittent problems. 
At first it wouldn't work with ATT DSL and/or the modem I have to use. Tech support helped me through firewall issues so I'd get it working, only to lose connection a few weeks later and have to get back to the cabin to manually reboot. Finally changing Piper's name in the modem settings to match Piper's name in set-up seems to have solved the problem. 
So now it's pretty reliable- even after a power outage it's able to reconnect. 
Main missing helpful feature would be to be able to reboot/ troubleshoot better remotely. And updating the app to look right on an iPhone 6 would be nice.

title: Ok
text:
With the new version I delete the events but the come back every time I reopen the app

This is a problem soon it will run out of room or space

Piper has some great features, you can move the camera using the app, zoom in & out. But one thing that is missing is a schedule, I don't know how many time I forget and walk on to my Apartment and set off the alarm after work. I have Dropcams and you can set a schedule, but I went to piper because Dropcams don't alway work right and you have to pay for online storage. Piper just record when the alarm goes off not taking up space. I prefer the piper it works on my iPhone and iPad...

title: Good design but buggy
text:
The app has a simple interface and is generally well designed but ultimately it frustrating to use due to connectivity and stability issues.

The app takes too long to connect to piper.  It's not unusual for it to take over 30 seconds to connect especially when moving between wifi/cellular networks.  This is a problem because when I come home it can take over a minute to disable the alarm.  Imagine how frustrating this can be if you set of the siren and can't turn it off.

The app rarely self updates with status changes.  For example if I open a door I have to hit refresh to see the status update if the zwave sensor.  The refresh can take anywhere from a second to a minute.

The status of zwave smart switches takes equally long to update.

Camera live view is unreliable with frequent failures to connect or dropouts.

I hope these performance issues get resolved quickly because the app needs further refinements and features such as:

- support for more zwave devices
- individual rule options for multiple pipers
- support for multiple user profiles
- privacy settings

title: Slow, unreliable, bad pet sensitivity
text:
If I get a notice that motion was detected I want to be able to see the live feed right away.  However the app is sluggish and often not responsive and even though I have a strong cellular connection the video takes a while to come up.  Additionally I want to view the video clip that was recorded during the motion detected event .  There is a long wait before it is viewable and it is often very difficult to get it to load.  I just had a motion detected event and while I was able to eventually see the live feed, still 5 minutes later I can't see the recorded clip. Says "media will be ready soon".

Also the pet sensitivity doesn't work . My tiny chihuahua sets off the motion detector constantly even though he's not moving fast and is not particularly close to the camera.

title: Security System 2.0 - Pretty Impressed
text: This newer version app works even better with Piper, an interesting new home monitoring security system that now has night vision. Even better with several units. No more call center and monthly fee. It lives off your wireless internet connection, gives you a live video feed to your smartphone and can remotely switch lights on and off and temperature, light, noise and motion sensors too. Pet friendly. Very much as advertised. App is well laid out and if you follow instructions, works like it should. Perfect for apartment dwellers who need a way to keep an eye on their home.

title: Would be no stars if possible :/
text: Seriously disappointed with the Piper. App itself seems really nice, but you never get to use it so it's a useless app. I got over the initial hiccups of getting the piper setup and working with the app and then it literally only worked for a week before it started working sporadically and then not at all. What I mean is that the app no longer connects with the piper despite everything I've tried. The piper hardware is locked into the settings I last had it on so although it's still functional and sends notifications to my phone I have to physically power it down because I can't change the conditions for when to trigger the insanely loud siren. Maybe the good folks at piper have a firmware update ready to beam over soon but until then this is useless, in fact,  less than useless.

title: Good and Improving
text: FOB integration would be a welcome addition to allow family members without smart phones to disable security. Lower sensitivity on the pet at home feature is important. Better (faster) switching from Wi-Fi to cell data would be helpful. Unlike some who  posted here, I've found support to be very responsive. Thanks, Ian!  I run two systems in two different states, one for surveillance and one for security. I had to make router setting adjustments on both, and got good help on what was needed in both cases. Blacksumac continues to update the app--3 times in the last month. It is far too soon to give up on this innovative product.

title: Great Device for Apartment Dwellers
text: I have been using this unit for > 12 months and have been very satisfied as to what it can do in such a small package.  It is a security system, pet friendly and allows secure real time video streaming.  The camera resolution could be better but it is good enough.  I have 2 units on the one network - it allows for multiple units.  Also great for monitoring a second home if you have a wireless network there.  Plucky Canadian company.  Not sure why the short sucky review.  Very undeserved, This system really works for me and solves my problem.

title: This version is a step backward
text:
Why did you people change the UI of the app for the worst? It is SO counterintuitive compared to the previous version.  The icons are super small, the zwave devices are hard to find and you also removed the battery indicator. The lame attempt at adding the video thumbnail is just dumb if it still just shows you the last frame from when it last watched (so annoying to open the app at night to see a video frame of a daytime shot).  Please Please bring back the old app all it needed was to be faster. Especially during those times when someone accidentally triggers the alarm. 

However, on a positive note... the newly integrated IFTTT recipes are a great forward step but you tool two back when you redesigned the app

title: Piper Needs To Fix This
text:
The Piper is a great product, beautifully designed, simple to set up, and simple to use. 
Unfortunately, I had to return mine because it lacks an “auto-reset” feature, i.e., once it’s been triggered and records a 35-second video clip it stops monitoring for motion until you’ve MANUALLY reset it from your iPhone.  If you’re busy, don’t notice the alarm, and don’t reset Piper, you now have NO ALARM and no subsequent video clips if there’s new motion a few minutes later.
I’ve suggested to Piper that they upgrade the software to allow the user to select an “auto-reset” feature.  If they do that, I’d buy it again in a heartbeat.

title: Overall good, but new versions seems buggy
text: I don't mind the changes to the app as so many here do. I haven't really ever used vacation mode so I don't miss it. My only issue is that Piper seems to lose connection quite a bit more often in this version. Quite a nuisance when you're standing at your front door waiting for the app to connect so you can walk inside without tripping the siren. Or worse, you forget to disarm before opening walking in, the siren goes off and there's nothing to do but unplug the thing and tear out the batteries. Please fix the bugs and I'll be a happy camper.

title: TERRIBLE UPDATE
text:
I normally dont write reviews, but this "update" is horrible. I dont know why they took a product that was intuitive, informative and simple to use and "improve it" by hiding all the information behind tiny icons that are hard to see, read and make sense of. Also the iconms for arming/disarming the system are also tiny and the all look alike. 

On the old app, when you opened it, there was the control pannel with 4 options, the current status of all of the door/window monitors and remote light switches- now you have a picture just snapped of the room Piper is monitoring, totally invading your privacy, and you need to search for the tiny icon to get to the info on the devices. 

Take us back to the old app, please.

title: Works Great for Me
text: I read the one star reviews after I had ordered my Piper unit. I feared than when my unit arrived that I would experience a similar outcome. Instead, everything works terrifically. I feel sorry for the users that did not find this to be so. Maybe their problems are with their internet connection. The App works great, very fast and accurate. True, the “Vitals” pane is fairly useless but certainly not a deal breaker. I am ordering another unit with additional sensors today. Great App and system.

title: New update
text: I really dislike the new update. It seems they wanted to make things MORE complicated! I wish I could get the old app back with the logical dashboard down at the bottom and the vacation mode back in place. That was more usefull when you have a dog at home in the away mode but not the vacation mode. Now there's only an away mode and you have to go in and change the rules depending on if your are merely away or on vacation. The indoor and outdoor temp. reading are difficult to see a lot of the time when they are superimposed on the video. Geeze...

title: Piper continues to trail the pack
text: Piper is a slick-looking device with a great marketing team behind it.  Once you get one, however, you realize how far behind they are vs. the competition (Smartthings, Vera, etc.)  This update attempts to improve the product, but offers just more eye-candy (marketing-driven software development) and breaks a fundamental feature - deleting events no longer works.  One useful new feature, if it works, is the ability to have Piper re-arm itself after an event.  This, of course, should have been included since day one - who needs a security device that doesn't stay armed? - but took almost three years to be included.

title: Not connected to piper and worst interface update
text: The recent update ruined the system. Now the app shows "not connected to piper". I cannot view the video but I get alerts from door sensor accessory and I can also see the home vitals. The new interface is worse and confusing. Why on earth would you replace simple to understand words like "vacation" with nonsense confusing words like "armed away" , "armed stay" words ? And the icons used for these modes are poor choice too. Armed in mode is shown as "person inside home" so one would look for "person outside home" for armed away , but no.. it has arrow popping out of home. You ruined a clean interface and gave us a clunky interface.

title: Great potential - not realized
text:
This security/automation product has so much potential but it seems like the stability issues and features are getting little if any effort from the development team. I'm sure the founders cashed out when icontrol bought the company. That does little good for those of us who are relying on this product. 

The app often has difficulty connecting to Piper. I found that sometimes it helps to terminate the app and reload it. Other times it just takes many tries over many minutes to actually connect, quite a nuisance when a false alarm is going off. 

The only update to Z wave support since this was launched is support for a dimmer module. I'd like to see support for glass breakage detectors, water detectors, motion sensors and other Z wave products but it doesn't seem like this is a priority for the company. 

I was an early adopter buying this during the initial funding campaign. I'm sorry that I bought it. Knowing what I know now I'd pick something else.

title: Great product and app *updated
text: I had previously given this a poor review due to the fact that it did not work well with T-Mobile for quite some time. The issues seem to have been worked out and I am happy as a clam with both the product and the app. As far as home security goes I don't think there is better bang for the buck. All systems have their flaws (this one is being reliant on a wifi connection) but for the price and with no monthly fee this is a pretty easy decision.

title: I LOVE LOVE LOVE my Piper!
text:
We were looking in to getting home security after buying our new home, and couldn't really afford the ones like ADT ect.. So this fit perfect in our budget. 

After my husband deployed to Iraq, I was left alone with a toddler far away from family and friends, so having Piper helped ease my mind. 

I haven't yet encountered any issues or glitches since having it. I wanted to wait about 5 months before writing a review just in case, but so far it's been PERFEXT!!

title: Don't waste your time or money! Buy Arlo
text:
Don't waste your time or money. These cameras are very unreliable. They keep disconnecting from the network and very often you have to do manufacturing resets, which takes a lot of your time every time. No, there is no issue with my Wi Fi or Internet connection. 
I brought a couple of Arlo cameras and for over 6 months testing them I haven't have any issues with them. No even once. Guess what? I'm getting rid of Piper and getting Arlo. They are cheaper, they are easy to install and I don't keep wasting my time dealing with "connection issues". Really Piper! Fix the issues and stop taking money and the time of many people. Shameful!!!

title: Works for my use so far
text: Video quality is very good. I haven't had to use the siren function but it seems to work well for monitoring the home. Note: I had the issue with not being able to connect. My master Piper unit didn't complete a firmware update. Had to do a factory reset. Take out batteries and unplug, wait 60 seconds, replace batteries only, hold down button on back until it flashes red then green/yellow, release button, wait for it to turn blue, then plug in to power and set up as new in the app.

title: Hit or Miss, mainly Miss
text: Everything on the website makes this appear to be a best-in-class solution.  I've had the Piper for 2 years and counterintuitively it has gotten worse over time due to the software updates.  With every update some piece of functionality becomes buggy and unusable.  As many users have stated, Piper only records one incidence and then stops until you reset the system.  Plus, the hardware is slow and video lags.  Also, since they sold the company about a year ago, it has been about profits over product.  So disappointing. I wish I could get my money back.

title: Divided
text: Love the product when it works it's great. At first had a lot of trouble but a lot of support they thought it was the AT&T modem/router so got a new one from AT&T setup and it worked great for two days now all of a sudden it can't connect. Rebooted the modem/router and the linksys router no help still can't connect. Will have to go back to ground zero and reset everything. When it's working it is great when it's not way to hard to trouble shoot. Spend a lot of time when it's down. Is it the modem, router, piper unit you basically have to go back to square one to set it up again. Loved it while it's working

title: What Should Have Been
text: The system is easy to set up, easy to monitor, and plays well with other ZWave accessories. I even think the app is fairly well designed and pretty easy to use. I love the system controls and customization options. There's just one problem. It doesn't work...at all. The system ran fine for about half a day after set up. We tested it dozens of times from home wi-fi and remotely. Now it doesn't connect to anything and doesn't read input from accessories even though it says they're being monitored. We now have a totally useless home security system. FIX CONNECTION ISSUE IMMEDIATELY and I bet this would be a five star app.

title: Useless pos without a working app
text: Piper app no longer working. I cannot connect my piper nv at all anymore. It worked fairly well for a month up until the past two weeks constantly disconnecting and now it cannot connect at all. I just tried calling tech support and it says "we are experiencing higher call volumes and cannot take your call, please leave a message."...Only it doesn't even let me leave a message and just keeps playing music. This is too expensive to have issues like this, let alone it is completely useless with the app not working. I am extremely unhappy with this product and this company.

title: Garbage System
text: It's not just the app that is horrible, Piper has really been a bad system from day 1. I purchased a system early on and it never worked as advertised. There are constant disconnects and being able to access the device through the app only works about half the time. As I sit here and write this I am currently unable to access Piper through the app. Attempting to contact support is impossible and doing so through their Facebook site resulted in them banning me. Needless to say I have moved all critical security devices over to SmartThings and Piper has been relegated to acting as an overpriced, stupid looking camera on a shelf in my home.

title: Awful experience from the start
text:
No 5ghz support, but that's fine, because my router broadcasts in both. However, that didn't seem to matter -- the app frequently disconnected, which made for a fun time while setting up the door sensor, which sounded the siren but did not allow me to actually shut it off via the app, so I had to rip the stand and back of the battery case off before someone else called the cops.

I'm going to be asking for a refund immediately. This system is beautifully marketed but poorly executed. And now I get to go back to worrying about my building suffering another break-in the next time I go out of town.

title: Good performance, needs consistency in away mode
text: The piper app performance is good. I can connect remotely and check in my dog at home. A weather alert even triggers when it's freezing outside. When my dog triggers the motion detector in away mode, additional instances of movement are not indicated. I can walk up to the unit and wave, yet no notification of movement... Seems odd since it is a home security device. Zooming in on the home stats is also desirable.

title: Horrible app redesign
text: This review is specific to the app redesign, not the Piper product or its functionality which I love. The old saying goes, it it ain't broke don't fix it.. Piper took an app that was easy to navigate and created a confusing hard to see app, using flat colors, size 6 fonts and impossibly to understand icons. specifically red and off reds and flat icons that require a microscope to decipher... A quarter of the home page is blank !? With a size 6 weather status...I see no other reason for this redesign.. Not to mention my Piper required a reset to reconnect to the new app. This app should have been rejected on the grounds of design (ok I know they don't do that)

title: PuppyCam
text: I love the App and my Piper system! I call it my PuppyCam! I travel a good bit and have three 4-legged kids back at the house! My Piper lets me make sure the pet sitter comes by and takes care of "the kids"! I found the voice feature to be great at letting me warn 'Crazy Mason' not to eat my furniture...lol! The system was easy to install (I am not a real tech kind of person)! The App gives me easy access to the device and my home! Very cool!

title: Security and video
text: I purchased the high quality Piper with night vision. I use it to watch a apartment I rent that is three hours away from my home in the desert. What I like about the Piper than the other camera devices is it as an audible alarm, a temperature feature to let me know if the desert heat is destroying my property and view of four different camera shots. What is missing is a built in SD card to store pictures of thefts. Other than that is is holding up great.

title: Slow and unreliable with sensors
text:
I know building a product like this must be very hard, but there are two enormous flaws that are hard to get past. 

As others have said, it takes far too long to initialize the app every time. As it's a security app, every second counts. I can't understand why the app simply can't be active in the background and require a simple (1-2 second) refresh when you come back to it.

The other extremely frustrating issue is how unreliable the connections are to door/window sensors. Those things are pricey, and when Piper seems to register them as open or closed at random, it undermines the security of your household in a big way.

If those two bugs (and they are most definitely bugs, this is not a feature request) were fixed, I'd gladly "double down" and go further with Piper as our home security system.

title: Good so far
text: Works very good for such a new product. It will be interesting to see how it evolves. I'm really wanting ifttt integration so it can work with some other devices I have. Changing wifi networks was not as easy as it should be. One suggestion for anyone setting one up is (or home automation in general) create a household email account so you can share piper alerts with housemates and not clutter up your primary mail box with events.

title: So much unfulfilled potential
text:
This system could be so great, but it's not. They farm out auto-arming and location notices to third party software, with unhelpful results. The system itself works great until it doesn't; customer service is a one-trick pony. They are polite, but hardly helpful. Wait a few years until they get their act together.

Update 28 Feb 2017: changing from two stars to one. Now the app won't even open. You call customer support and are told you can't talk to anyone due to high call volume. They tell you leave a message and then put you on endless hold. What a waste of money.

title: Works Great for New Tech
text:
Works great for new tech.  Have not found the app to be buggy.  You’re able to watch live video from your piper, monitor room temperature, noise, humidity, and set rules for when a door/window sensor is triggered.  You can arm and disarm the device with a set of four profiles.  

I am looking forward to having multiple users allowed to disarm the device.

title: Does not work as advertised.
text:
When I first set it up it downloaded updates. It then froze when it installed the updates. I had to remove batteries and remove power and restart app to get it unfreeze. 

Then i could not communicate with it outside my homes network which defeated the products whole purpose.   Support forum offered no help. Support email told me to reboot.  Nothing worked. 

Next it could not recognize any movement with pets at home setting. Tried adjusting sensitivity. Did not work. 

Then it would constantly lose communication with itself and send me texts saying it was not connected. 

Next two way audio didn't work. There was this loud screeching when we tried to use it.  Didn't work. 

The z wave pack was shipped separately and wouldn't arrive until weeks after I had the piper. So all I had was a video camera with no door or window sensors. 

Overall bad experience.  Going to return it.

title: If ZERO rating were available!
text:
Biggest waste of $300 ever. The app NEVER reconnects to piper nor does piper ever reconnect to the Internet following a power failure. Piper must be totally set up as a NEW UNIT after every power failure v
I've spent countless hours wasted going through the RESET options over & over & over again. Then sometimes it will go back online and sometimes not! Mostly NOT! 
It has been 17 days, every day trying to reconnect. 17 days- NO WORKING PIPER!!!!!
Unplugging modem, plugging in modem, unplugging Piper, taking out batteries, putting in batteries, plugging up piper, resetting iPhone wifi to Piper, and continually get the same error notice : CAN'T LOAD SETUP INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE INTERNET. CHECK INTERNET CONNECTION. Eeeeeekkkkkkkkk

**##!!!!!!!BEWARE OF PIPER. SOUNDS GOOD BUT IS A PIECE OF CRAP!  The App is horrible. It wasn't too bad 2 updates ago, but the new app is pathetic as is the Piper! 
Signed: very dissatisfied customer who will be hitting social media warning people not to buy PIPER!

title: Muuuuch better!
text:
I must admit, when I got my Piper NV last week and saw the app did not support iPhone 6s I was a little worried. Was I using an outdated company to protect my property?

But seeing the new app made me breathe a sigh of relief. The new app is sharp and a lot cleaner. Connectivity to my Piper has also improved. 

Next on their list should be implementing 3D Touch support. It would be perfect to access your camera and  arm/disarm the Piper straight from the home screen!

title: Great product brings peace of mind
text: I've been using piper for 1 and a half years and I'm very impressed how well it handles. It gives me peace of mind knowing that my home is secure and I can keep a close eye in my home from the office. It functions well with my door sensors and a light fixture I installed. I cannot recommend this app/product enough to my family and friends.

title: Very Poor App and Product
text: Recently purchased a Piper and I have spent over 2 days trying to get this to work with Piper. It continuously states that it can't find a heart beat. Called support, very very hard to get in touch with them. When I was able to get in touch, they insist its a problem with my wireless router. However after trying 6 different locations including public wi-fi, the app still will not communicate with the device and complete the setup. Very poor product. Would highly recommend staying away from and buying something else such as the iSecurity or Canary!

title: Great concept
text: Have only had one issue and I believe that was with my router. You need to have solid wifi or no device will work properly. Used the help chat and got it fixed quickly. I love this compared to the home security companies offerings.  You can decide if you need to call someone and NO FEE(that is huge). Just need to incorporate a thermostat and I will move my review to 5.

title: Horrible update
text: As others have complained the updated version is much worse than the old one. I really miss the "vacation" mode where I could turn everything on, and have the "away" mode for when we were just out for an hour or two. The new modes are confusing, I had to disable most alerts for when we were home, my trusted circle just started ignoring the false alarms. The colors are hard too see, the font is too small and the icons are confusing. Anyway to delete the new version and get the older one?

title: Still pleased
text: The app continues to improve with its fixes and updates. I had a problem with my original piperNV and customer service was 5 stars! Replacement product with a fast turnaround time. The response time for their email was excellent as well. I will stay a loyal piper customer as long as the products continue to work as advertised and serving my families needs.

title: Simple to install, easy to use
text: I bought mine with the door window sensors for my apartment slider and front door. Install took me less than an hour. I am having a great time checking on my cats and I actually caught my landlord coming by to check in my heater! This is a great product for apartments. I have ordered one for my in-laws.

title: Latest Update Bug
text: I've really enjoyed the Piper system as a whole and has done well in what it's meant to do. But in this latest update, no matter which Piper camera I choose to look through on the app, it only chooses one of them. So I'm not able to look through the other two cameras. If it weren't for this glitch I'd rate this app and system 5 stars.

title: Mostly Useless
text: We got a Piper so that I could have a security system that wecould access remotely and use to monitor our house. That being said, when the companion app won't connect and we have no idea whether the Piper is even active or not, it's not very useful as a security device.  I contacted customer support, and even though THEY could see that the Piper is active, they had no idea why none of my devices would connect. They'll escalate the case, but for the time being, my house may or may not be protected while we're not home. Great.

title: Lousy update experience
text:
Pre-update my system ran almost flawlessly. Post-update... had to factory reset multiple units before they would cooperate, Piper regularly loses contact with the network, the app regularly tells me it can't contact Piper, and I'm regularly told there are no settings established for Away Mode when there really are. Please don't "fix" what isn't "broken" Piper... you're terrible at it :-/

6/3/16 - updated again... same old, same old. Ready to get rid of the system altogether as it's becoming more trouble than it is worth.

title: Works great....needs iPhone 6 support
text: This app works flawlessly with the camera and door sensors. I am very happy with the purchase and look forward to trying more home integration. My only criticism is that the app is not optimized for iPhone 6 and 6 Plus. They have been out for over a year, and nearly all of my apps have been updated except for this one.

title: Garbage
text:
The latest 'update' didn't fix the previous issues with this camera (which were triggered by the September updates).
'Can't reach Piper' when attempting to change any settings at all.
The live video feature does work, so the device is maintaining a connection.
Terrible app, made even worse with this last 'effort' from the bright minds in charge of programming. 
Customer service doesn't have a clue, they just escalate tickets that never get resolved, no email communication, zero support. What a joke!

title: Good app but terrible updates
text: The application does not support iOS 10 as stated.  It does not allow to add wireless devices or setup additional piper devices.  Had to use Piper in iOS 9 to get it to work, but now all my devices are in iOS 10, this app is useless to setup additional devices.   Where is the battery status of the accessories?    It took getting used to the new dashboard, not bad, but dont remove functionality please.  If I dont get an update that fixes my issues soon, will probably look for competition products.

title: Removed Remote Live Viewing?
text:
Update: live view is the grey banner with temp sensor reading in lower right. Love ITFF / dashboard is more intuitive minus the grey banner live remote view thing/ guessing others will have this pseudo complaint in 2.0.0

Removed Remote Live Viewing? Seriously only recorded alerts and no live viewing without an alert   sensor trigger?

title: A lot of promise but still a ways away
text: This system could be great if the company had any engineering design skills.  Beautiful concept & design but low quality programming and not well thought through from the user standpoint.  Like other reviewers I've had a series of problems getting this system working for more than a few weeks at a time.  Save your money.

title: Worst App Ever
text: Piper was a great system until the most "recent" update on September 19th. Since the update, my app shows "not connected to piper". If tried resetting and following the set up process to reset up my piper, but nothing works. I spent a lot of money on this system and feel this is ridiculous that's it's been three months since an update has come out to address this issue that it appears from others' comments that they are experiencing the same issue. iControl should start issuing refunds to customers.

title: Worst upgrade EVER
text:
This was a great app/ tool, but somehow the developers took a great user friendly interface and destroyed it. I'm very disappointed with the new interface and changes. I want the old look back, otherwise I have no interest in this product. If it isn't fixed, I will terminate my account and look for a better option. 
Also, what's with the incessant request to enable the mic? I don't want to enable it on one of my devices. Why do I have to get an annoying pop-up EVERY SINGLE TIME I go to view the camera output?

title: Horrible, horrible "upgrade"
text: They have taken a very good app and turned it into an awful one.  I can' find anything. It took me  fifteen minutes to figure out how to turn my light off and on and I only stumbled over it by accident.  Instead of this useless change they could have given the app the ability to hold two Pipers in two locations without logging in and out, an actual useful function. The Piper is an excellent device but is terribly mismanaged...time for some new personnel who listen customers.

title: First Review
text:
I have been reading the reviews after I saw an update was available and decided I owed it to piper to write one of my own. 

I have had piper for just over a year now and have had excellent results. I installed for cameras and recently added a fifth night vision camera at my new house with a new job after a move. While I have had some issues with the connectivity of the Z wave, once I finally got them working they have worked very well. I do wish for a couple of things including a more expensive list of Z wave support but I'm currently using a Wink for a few other areas. It helps to have both systems in case one goes down but I would like the integration of the two at some point.  The system has worked well for the security of my home as well as being able to monitor my young children who like to go in and out of doors without anyone knowing. The support has been amazing, fast, and reliable. I trust that this will continue and the capabilities will expand. I looked at several systems and options before I decided to go with piper because of the expense of options of the camera itself and the flexibility of the system. I would like to see an option in the software to be able to view all of my cameras at once as well as remove the limitation of five cameras that can be linked together as I could use a couple of more for key areas on my property. I will say that I am fortunate enough to have some high-speed Internet which included at one point a fiber optic option and hope to have that fiber optic option again in my new location. A good Wi-Fi system is key and if you can get a static IP it helps but I currently do not have one and it is still working great.

title: Mixed feelings
text:
I have mixed feelings about the piper. On the one hand it's an amazing device. The camera works great. The ability to detect motion in the room works great. It integrates with Z wave devices, which lets you put sensors on your door and even take video when the door opens. That's all quite amazing.

The app is so so. I could complain about funkiness on the interface, but it works fine.

The real killer problem is login and network reliability. The system always takes a little while to login. And this is a pain when you're sitting at the door waiting to get into the house, or wanting to get on your way as you arm the system. Why oh why can't it save login state, and use the cloud database in a model view control scheme. Perhaps like my Rachio does. 

Sometimes this login delay is significant. Here, login fails, you have to restart the app, then go through another login attempt, and wait, and wait. Often, it has to re-login while you're using it, adding more frustrating delays to you getting the system armed or disarmed. That's a real pain when you're sitting outside the door, waiting to come into the house.

The other pain is that sometimes the unit itself loses network conductivity. The network still sees the unit there, but the unit doesn't respond. Perhaps it crashed. Perhaps it's in an infinite loop. Perhaps the server somewhere in the cloud is dead. Who knows. Other times the unit goes offline from the app perspective but is still posting events. Just more networking bugs.  

In fact, I'm writing this review tonight, because the system's network crashed while it was armed. It was not fun unplugging it and pulling the batteries while the siren was blasting.

I hope piper can fix all the login and networking problems. I recommend they go back to the books on this one. And then later post the code they use for login security on a developer forum as a study in what not to do. It will make great geek comedy.

title: I really want to love it
text:
EDIT 6/13/21: Does the developer ever intend to update this app? Piper devices have so much potential over their competitors. If only you would add scheduling. I wanted to cry when IFTTT support was removed. It added such functionality that Piper itself did not have. I am glad my devices still work, but would love an update. Anyone?

ORIGINAL POST: I really want to love the device, but nope. My issue isn’t with the app but the devices themselves. I have the Classic Piper (no night vision I think coming out with a security camera that does not have Night Vision is about the stupidest thing I could ever think of but I have digressed). Additionally, I have the Piper NV. My Piper NV constantly is out of sync with the Classic. When I arm my System the Classic will arm yet the NV will not and there are times that my NV will remain armed even though I have disarmed the System. In both cases the NV ignores my request to either arm itself or disarm itself. While the Classic behaves correctly every time. I end up unplugging it then replugging it which is a soft reboot. I have even gone through the process of setting it as if it were new. Sometimes this works but not for long and sometimes it doesn’t work at all. The one feature Piper has over its competitors is that it calls when it detects motion or loud sound when armed. I love that it is an immediate notification. All competitors just send you a text that you may or may not notice. That is why I haven’t completely given up on the device, but you have no idea how frustrating it is. What can be done? It would be nice if there was a way in the App to tell if the device is connected to the other and are in sync. To be able to see which network they are connected to and see the signal strength per device. Yes I can see the IP Address but that really isn’t telling much. This way I would know for sure if my issue is related to the proximity to my router or not. I only noticed this issue because the device kept staying armed even after I had disarmed it, then on another occasion I noticed that I had forgotten to disarm it and went near the Classic only after passing the NV and it started calling my phone. The Classic was armed while the NV was not. Which meant the entire time that I was out of my house only one was armed. Here I was thinking both were. Which is more of a concern than the other scenario. I really think I have a defective device but haven’t been able to get anyone from support to really confirm this.
